content: kitchener stitch repeat these 2 row until the flap is approximately square ending with row 1 for women s socks about 2 1/2 inches 6 25 cm is good for men 3 inches 7 5 cm put all sts on needles 2 and 3 onto one needle do the same with needles 1 and 4 thread a length of yarn onto a tapestry needle turn heel 1 go through the first st on the front needle as if to purl leave the st on the needle row 1 sl1 p to center of heel then 4 sts past p2tog p1 turn for children s 2 go through the first st on the back needle as if to knit leave the st on the needle socks leave fewer sts in the center for babies socks only leave the 2 center sts 3 go through the first st on the front needle as if to knit drop it off the needle then row 2 sl1 k until to the same number of sts past center ssk k1 turn go through the next st on the front needle as if to purl and leave it on the needle there will be the same number of unworked sts on each side of the heel flap 4 go through the first st on the back needle as if to purl drop it off the needle then row 3 sl1 p until 1 st rem bef gap made by turn p2tog p1 turn go through the next st on the back needle as if to knit and leave it on the needle row 4 sl1 k until 1 st rem bef gap made by turn ssk k1 turn repeat steps 3 and 4 until 1 st remains on each needle go through the st on the repeat row 3 and 4 until all sts have been worked ending with row 4 front needle as if to knit drop it off the needle go through the st on the back note if there aren t enough sts at the end of the row to work the p1 just p2tog and turn needle as if to purl drop it off work to the end of the next row ssk then go on to gusset instructions weave in ends ©2006 kate gilbert - www kategilbert com permission to redistribute granted provided this copyright notice remains intact not for sale or to be knit for resale
